article.headline: New Orleans 62, Samford 60
article.story: NEW ORLEANS (AP) -- Johnell Smith scored 16 points and Bo McCalebb had 14 points to go with a game-sealing steal as New Orleans edged Samford 62-60 on Saturday night. Kyle Buggs added 12 points for New Orleans (2-0), which led 57-50, but Samford (1-2) would cut its deficit to 61-60 on a 3-pointer by Phillip Ramelli with 26 seconds left. Samford then fouled A.J. Meredith, who hit one of two foul shots with 11 seconds left. Then McCalebb stole the ball from Robert Merritt on Samford's next possession and New Orleans ran out the clock. It was an unfitting end for Merritt, who led Samford with 16 points. Eddie Harper added 12 points for Samford and Ramelli finished with 10. The teams were tied at 29 at the half. New Orleans finished with a 40-36 rebounding advantage, which the Privateers needed as Samford outshot them 45 percent to 36 percent. Samford stayed in the game with outside shooting, hitting 11 3-pointers. Merritt shot 4-for-7 from long range. <
